âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Spot on, a good challenge in the available time
As for Shortest... here's an example solution that could get a lot shorter of course.
https://gist.github.com/escalonn/6a32a85de512556565024d280ef27d79

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Great contribution

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: I think the description is clear and this can be funny to do it ! :)

I think the description is clear and the problem is funny.
I wonder if this would be a better fit for classic puzzles rather than clashes, though I appreciate the challenge :)
(Got to 285 bytes in JS, but it took way more than 5 minutes to get there :D )

Cool puzzle! I don't see anything off about the statement at this moment except one point. Though it seems redundant, it helps to specify in the constraints that every word in the dictionary is unique in snake language.

However I personally don't think this puzzle is good for Shortest, since the minimum code size is much larger than most Shortest puzzles.

I think this is a good idea that still needs a bit of work.

The statement is not yet ready for Shortest or Fastest modes.  A competent programmer should be able to write the solution without using the starter code or reverse-engineering the test cases.  (Of course, reverse-engineering the test cases is part of the process in Reverse mode.)  

The Input section should have a line-by-line specification of the input.  You've got this in the stub for the starter code, but it belongs here too.

In the constraints, you should specify the maximum length of a vocabulary word and the maximum length of the transmission.  The stub generator code says these are each 1024, but you need to say it in English, too.

If this clash will be played in Fastest/Shortest mode, you have to write a clear statement about the rules of translation, and also specify the inputs and outputs clearly (follow the example in the contribution guidelines: https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/statement#guidelines ).

Alternatively (which I personally prefer for this clash), turn this clash into Reverse mode only and you can avoid all the additional writing.

Reference: "The description must be clear and unambiguous (for all games but reverse CoC)" from https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/contribution-guidelines

Thank you for your feedback aswell :)

As I commented above, I've updated the statement, input specification and constraints.
Do you think this is sufficient or should I clarify it further?

Thank you for your feedback :)
I have updated the statement, input specification and constraints.
Is this sufficient or should I clarify it further?

Thank you for the feedback :)

I modified the constraints; does this make it clearer or is this too much?

Personally, I'm curious what the shortest code could be; it's still supposed to be a challenge in my opinion. :)

Yeah, that's a thing I was contemplating - but it's supposed to be a challenge :)
I'm curious which the shortest code will be; 285 bytes in JS is already quite short for this^^
Thanks for the feedback :D
Thanks for the feedback :)
Awesome, thank you :D
this problem just came up for me in clash of code in shortest mode... i'm like "oh pick me, i know this one" ðŸ˜‚

Darn, that's awesome! :D
Did you win?
yeah, nobody else even got 100%... well it's a tougher one

You still have string(1024) in the stub for reading the word.  Should that be string(16) in light of the new constraints?

I'll look at this further when I have time to solve it in the IDE.
Good point, I adjusted both string inputs in regards to the constraints. Is this better? :)

Thanks, better now! Below are my comments:

Input section
* Please move the first sentence (Translate the received...) to the end of the Goal section.
* Please format "First Line:", "Next n lines:" and "Last line:" as bold.
* Please change "amount" to ", an integer for the number".

Constraints section
* Please change "all words" to "each [[word]]".
* Please format word as [[word]] in the last constraint.
Done aaaaand... done :D
...to the end of the "Goal" section :wink:
Whoops, I misread that, sorry :sweat_smile:
No worries! It's ok now :)
